entry.title: SoFly Releases Hannover Airport for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. SoFly has released its highly anticipated version of Hannover Airport (EDDV) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The international airport serves over 5 million passengers annually, making it the ninth-largest airport in Germany. Hannover Airport opened its doors in 1952. In 1973, it expanded with the introduction of two modern passenger terminals, A and B, which are still in operation today. The final terminal, C, was inaugurated in 1998. In the year 2000, the airport was connected by rail to the town of Hamelin through Hannover, and Paderborn was linked by rail a few years later in 2003. Today, Hannover Airport serves as a focus city for several airlines, including Corendon Airlines Europe, Eurowings, and TUI fly Deutschland. With a range of other airlines operating, the airport offers destinations across Europe, accommodating over 5 million passengers each year. The scenery comes packed with features such as interactive scenery technology, dynamic airport environment, moving ground transport, interior modelling, high-resolution texturing and modelling, and so much more. The newly released Hannover Airport is now available directly from SoFly for approximately $25.22. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold! â If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon!

entry.title: iBlueYonder Releases Dallas Love Field for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Developer iBlueYonder has released its latest scenery for X-Plane 12: Dallas Love Field (KDAL). Situated just over 5 nautical miles from downtown Dallas, this Texan airport accommodates more than 16 million passengers annually. Opened in 1917, the airport initially served as a training base for the U.S. Army Air Service during World War I. Following the war, it continued as a military air base until the City of Dallas purchased it in 1927, marking the beginning of civilian operations, with commercial flights starting shortly thereafter. During World War II, the airport was again utilized by the military. After the war, commercial traffic at the airport saw significant growth. Over the years, the airport has undergone various expansions and improvements. Today, it operates as a base for Southwest Airlines and JSX while also serving Delta Airlines. These airlines facilitate nearly 250,000 aircraft operations each year, handling over 16 million passengers. The scenery includes features such as a complete representation of the airport, a skyline of Dallas City, a detailed terminal interior, custom night lighting, hand-placed vegetation, and more. The newly released scenery is now available from SimMarket for approximately $21.16. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold! â If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon!

entry.title: Verticalsim Releases Southwest Florida International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Verticalsim has recently released their rendition of Southwest Florida International Airport (KRSW) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The airport serves Fort Myers and Southwest Florida and has a yearly average of 11 million passengers. RSW was built to replace Fort Myers' former main airport, Page Field, as it was considered too small and difficult to expand due to certain constraints (like a major highway, for example), starting anew elsewhere seemed the better idea. Construction started in 1980, and the airport was inaugurated on schedule three years later. It featured an 8400-foot runway and a terminal with 14 gates on two concourses. In 1993, a 50,000-square-foot Federal Inspection facility was annexed to the main concourse, and the runway was lengthened to 12,000 feet to better accommodate international service. The terminal underwent expansion in 1998 to keep up with the region's ever-growing demand for air travel. A new wing and three additional gates were added to Concourse B. An entirely new terminal project, with three concourses and 28 gates, started in 2002. Part of the original terminal had to be demolished to make room for the new one. It's an operating base for Breeze Airways, and served by Air Canada Rouge, Alaska Airlines, American Airlines, Avelo Airlines, Delta Air Lines, Discover Airlines, Frontier Airlines, JetBlue, Porter Airlines, Southwest Airlines, Spirit Airlines, Sun Country Airlines, United Airlines, and WestJet. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with an up-to-date ground layout, custom ground textures, performance-friendly optimization, an official GSX profile, custom high-grade aerial imagery, basic interiors for performance, and much more. It's available on Contrail for roughly $18.00, requiring at least 3.82 GB of free hard disk space to install.
